content: For each type of nut listed below - Almonds, Walnuts, Cashews, Pistachios, Hazelnuts - provide information about their nutritional benefits. Format your response as a table using markdown syntax.

Sure, here's a table that outlines the nutritional benefits of almonds, walnuts, cashews, pistachios, and hazelnuts. I've included some key nutrients for comparison.

| Nutrient          | Almonds (28g)       | Walnuts (28g)       | Cashews (28g)       | Pistachios (28g)    | Hazelnuts (28g)     |
|-------------------|---------------------|---------------------|---------------------|---------------------|---------------------|
| Calories          | 164                 | 185                 | 157                 | 159                 | 180                 |
| Protein (g)       | 6.0                 | 4.3                 | 5.2                 | 5.9                 | 4.2                 |
| Fat (g)           | 14.0                | 18.5                | 12.4                | 12.9                | 17.2                |
| - Saturated (g)   | 1.0                 | 1.7                 | 2.2                 | 1.3                 | 1.3                 |
| - Monounsaturated (g)| 8.8                | 8.0                 | 6.0                 | 5.3                 | 12.2                |
| - Polyunsaturated (g)| 3.2                | 10.4                | 2.2                 | 5.3                 | 2.1                 |
| Carbohydrates (g)| 6.0                 | 3.9                 | 9.2                 | 7.7                 | 4.7                 |
| - Fiber (g)      | 3.5                 | 1.9                 | 0.9                 | 2.9                 | 2.7                 |
| - Sugar (g)      | 1.2                 | 0.7                 | 1.0                 | 1.1                 | 1.3                 |
| Calcium (mg)     | 75                  | 9                  | 10                  | 28                  | 44                  |
| Iron (mg)        | 1.0                 | 0.7                 | 1.9                 | 1.1                 | 1.2                 |
| Magnesium (mg)   | 77                  | 44                  | 22                  | 33                  | 73                  |
| Phosphorus (mg)  | 135                 | 49                  | 104                 | 121                 | 110                 |
| Potassium (mg)   | 200                 | 254                 | 160                 | 288                 | 225                 |
| Zinc (mg)        | 0.9                 | 1.0                 | 1.1                 | 1.1                 | 0.9                 |
| Vitamin E (mg)   | 7.3                 | 0.2                 | 0.1                 | 0.1                 | 15.0                |
| Omega-3 Fatty Acids (mg)| 254                | 254                 | 0                   | 0                   | 0                   |

**Notes:**

- **Almonds:** High in vitamin E and magnesium, almonds are also a good source of healthy fats, fiber, and protein.

- **Walnuts:** Rich in omega-3 fatty acids and antioxidants, walnuts support heart health and brain function.

- **Cashews:** Lower in fat compared to some other nuts, cashews are high in copper and magnesium, which are essential for bone health and metabolism.

- **Pistachios:** Higher in protein and fiber than many other nuts, pistachios also contain potassium and vitamin B6.

- **Hazelnuts:** Packed with vitamin E and monounsaturated fats, hazelnuts also offer significant amounts of folate and manganese.

Each type of nut offers a unique nutrient profile, making them all valuable additions to a balanced diet.
